profile.thesis: Amazon.com is a very large, longstanding US retail platform (marketCapitalization 2,159,329.27; IPO 1997-05-15) whose scale and capital base support multi-quarter durability through investments in distribution, technology and customer reach, creating a structural moat versus smaller rivals.

profile.risk: High competitive intensity in retail, margin compression from price/fulfillment competition, regulatory and antitrust pressure, macro-driven consumer weakness, and execution risk on large-scale investments that could dilute returns.
profile.brief: Large-cap US retail leader with durable scale advantages; buy for long-term exposure to structural moat but monitor execution, margins and regulatory/competitive risks closely.
